page.title: 20PADSTOW ARTIST'S SKETCH CLUB
page.content: Nationally known artist Kevin Platt runs a fortnightly Art Club for children.It meets on Tuesdays during the winter and we do all different kinds of drawing so we do not get bored. Kevin Platt was born in the North of England but moved to Padstow over 10 years ago to set up his studio here.He specialises in paintings of old Padstow and S.W.England in the early 20th Century.He was commissioned by the R.N.L.I.to paint a set of four plates depicting lifeboats in action (including the Padstow lifeboat the "Catherine and James Macfarlane"),with the proceeds from the sale of the limited edition going to the R.N.L.I. He has also spent many summers in the South of France, encapturing the mood of the more rural side of the country in his paintings.
